Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use intensive pronouns (e.g., myself, ourselves).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recognize variations from standard English in their own and others' writing and speaking, and identify and use strategies to improve expression in conventional language.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Spell correctly.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6–8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they “see” and “hear” when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6–8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection and paraphrasing.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how it contributes to a topic, text, or issue under study.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, sound) and visual displays in presentations to clarify information.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. (See grade 6 Language standards 1 and 3 on page 53 for specific expectations.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence clearly.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the argument presented.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.(Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3up to and including grade 6 on page53.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres [e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories]in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics”).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not”).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.
